msContents.summary: Rashi's commentary on the Pentateuch with the Hafṭarot, on the Five Scrolls and on the Hafṭarot for festivals.

collation.p:
37 quires: i8-1 (folios 1-7), ii-xv8 (folios 8-119), xvi6 (folios 120-125), xvii-xxx8 (folios 126-238), xxxi6 (folios 239-245), xxxii-xxxvi8 (folios 246-285), xxxvii2 (folios 286-287).
Catchword at the end of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of 14th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r2 decorated initial words, in brown ink.
126r2 decorated initial words, in brown ink.

binding.p: Post-1600. Leather boards with embossed golden coat of arm (of Francis Henry Egerton?). Spine: 'Commentarius In Pentateuchum. Quinque Megilloth. Et Lectiones Propheticas. Exaratus Anno 1346. Mus. Brit. Bibl. Egerton. 872. Plut. DXIX.E.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum from Hen. Bohn, 26 September 1840: inscribed (flyleaf [iii]v); probably Henry George Bohn (b. 1796, d. 1884), translator and publisher. Bought by the British Museum, using the Bridgewater fund (£12,000 bequeathed in 1829 by Francis Henry Egerton, 8th Earl of Bridgewater (b. 1756, d. 1829).
